meanings.definition: A person who defrauds others by deceit or trickery.
meanings.sent1: The swindlers convinced the old man to give them all his money.
meanings.sent2: The police caught the swindlers who were scamming people with fake lottery tickets.
meanings.sent3: The swindlers tried to sell a bridge to the gullible tourists.
meanings.sent4: The swindlers were like wolves in sheep's clothing, preying on the vulnerable.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the swindlers lurking in the shadows, ready to deceive the unsuspecting.

meanings.definition: To cheat or defraud someone by deceit or trickery.
meanings.sent1: She swindlers her way into getting free meals at fancy restaurants.
meanings.sent2: The con artist swindlers innocent people out of their life savings.
meanings.sent3: He swindlers his friends in a friendly game of cards.
meanings.sent4: The fake investment scheme swindlers unsuspecting investors out of millions.
meanings.sent5: The smooth-talking scam artist swindlers his victims with promises of easy money.
